title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
0 - Makes an attempt, but answer is without merit because it rewrites the question or makes only incorrect statements.

1 - Can only vaguely link either architecture or sculptural tradition to the classical past through general rather than specific details.

2 - Correctly identifies one element, either architectural or figural, and vaguely understands that the form of this early Christian work is dependent on the classical past.

3 - Correctly identifies, with some specificity of detail and nomenclature, at least two elements linking the work to the classical past, of which at least one must be architectural and one figural.

OR

Correctly identifies three elements, all either architectural or figural.

OR

Correctly identifies three elements, divided two and one, one of which is less specific in detail or nomenclature.

4 - Correctly identifies, with some specificity of detail and nomenclature, three elements linking the work to the classical past, of which at least one must be architectural and at least one figural.
